item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Folder Structure Here’s a rough overview of what’s what.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, here’s exactly how to do that!

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: Hosting on GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!
Communication Task Topics and Response Formats As taken from the ICE guidance, the following topics and responses can be mixed-and-matched in order to make up the Communication Task question.
üè° Homepage üîß Civil Engineering MOC üìñ Areas MOC üî® Site Work MOC üíª Design MOC üíµ Commercial MOC üè´ Professional Review MOC üåç Sustainability MOC

item.title: 1. Understanding and Practical Application of Engineering
item.description: *Taken from The Civil Engineering Exam 1. Understanding and Practical Application of Engineering This Attribute is subdivided into 8 parts if you are aiming for Chartered Engineer level.

item.title: 2. Management and Leadership
item.description: *Taken from The Civil Engineering Exam 2. Management and Leadership What does this mean exactly? If you read the text carefully from the first attribute, you will notice that half of the sub-attributes relate to whether you are driving the industry forward with your engineering research or application.

item.title: 2021 ICE Presidential Address Notes
item.description: 2021 ICE Presidential Address Notes ICE Presidential Address 2021, online Current President: Ed McCann Rachel Skinner passes over the baton to Ed McCann.

item.title: 2022 Presidential Address Notes
item.description: 2022 Presidential Address Notes Keith Howells takes over from Ed McCann, as ICE President for 2022. üïô See last year’s notes: 2021 ICE Presidential Address Notes

item.title: 3. Commercial Ability
item.description: *Taken from The Civil Engineering Exam 3. Commercial Ability During the¬†2013 ICE Review sessions, Commercial Ability¬†was the most divided failure point, with 70% of Hong Kong applicants failing on this Attribute alone.

item.title: 4. Health Safety and Welfare
item.description: *Taken from The Civil Engineering Exam 4. Health Safety and Welfare Health and Safety is a serious and important topic in the construction industry.

item.title: 5. Sustainable Development
item.description: *Taken from The Civil Engineering Exam 5. Sustainable Development While there are now people making whole careers as environmental specialists, your job as a Chartered Civil Engineer will require very intricate involvement with sustainability studies, as described by these sub-parts.

item.title: 6. Interpersonal Skills and Communication
item.description: *Taken from The Civil Engineering Exam 6. Interpersonal Skills and Communication You cannot succeed in engineering, or any skilled profession, without strong communication skills.

item.title: 7. Professional Commitment
item.description: *Taken from The Civil Engineering Exam 7. Professional Commitment The last of ICE’s 7 Attributes is Professional Commitment. A) Understand and comply with the ICE Code of Conduct

item.title: Areas MOC
item.description: Areas I have many different interests, from music to hot-air ballooning! This page is a directory of some of the topics which may interest civil engineers, or those who are interested in technology and productivity.

item.description: Asset management [!NOTE] Assets An asset is a resource with economic value that an individual, corporation or country owns or controls with the expectation that it will provide a future benefit.

item.description: Calculating vertical settlement in relation to wall deflection When using a sheet pile or other type of Retaining Wall, the deflection of that wall can influence the ground around it in regards to vertical settlement.

item.title: Chartered Civil Engineer (CEng)
item.description: Chartered Civil Engineer (CEng) A Chartered Member of the [[Institution of Civil Engineers]] is an individual who has shown the ability and gained sufficient experience to be recognsied as at the top of their field.

item.title: Classes of Carbon-Dioxide Emissions
item.description: Scopes of Carbon-Dioxide Emissions *Taken from Plana.Earth guide here. Carbon emissions are responsible for 81% of all overall greenhouse gas emissions, and companies including construction are largely responsible for this.

item.title: Compensation Event (CE)
item.description: Compensation Event (CE) A compensation event is a reassessment of cost or the allocated time to complete a task due to events outside the control of the Subcontractor.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Construction Design and Management Regulations (CDM) (2015)
item.description: Construction Design and Management Regulations (CDM) (2015) The CDM regulations apply to all construction work: they set out the legal requirements for managing health and safety on construction projects.

item.title: Contract
item.description: Contract Every contract essentially boils down to three components, and a contract cannot be legally binding without any of them. These are:

item.title: Contractor
item.description: Contractor A contractor is anyone manages construction work, or who directly employs or engages construction workers. Contractors can include subcontractors, any individual self-employed worker or business that carries out and manages construction work.

item.title: Converting track load to an equivalent line load
item.description: Converting track load to an equivalent line load By using [[CIRIA]] 760, a point load or line load can be converted into an equivalent line load for use in slope analysis or other situations.

item.description: Core Clauses [[NEC3]] contracts have a set of nine [[Core Clauses]]. These are the same in every form, and cover the [[Contract]] basics.

item.title: HB loading
item.description: HB loading HB loading refers to BS5400-2, whereby one unit of HB is equal to 10kN per axle. In typical highways design, the road and structures should be assessed for 45 units of HB, or 450kN per axle.

item.description: ICE Code of Conduct The ICE Code of Conduct can be summarised by one phrase: do the right thing. The code of conduct sets out a set of duties which should be followed by ICE members in order to behave ethically and in standing with the ICE.

item.description: Kaizen Sarah Harvey 2020 URL:: Goodreads My Rating: 2.5 Genres: [[Habits]], [[Japan]], [[Mindfulness]] #content/book Mental Model MM:: Kaizen is an approach to life revolving around continuous improvement, themes similar to those presented in Atomic Habits - James Clear (2018) or Make Time; namely, ways to slowly steer your life to your desired destination through a series of small, incremental improvements.

item.title: Keith Howells
item.description: Keith Howells Keith Howells is the 2022 ICE President, the 158th to hold the position. An ICE fellow, Keith has had a distinguished career in the planning, design and construction of hydraulic structures and river engineering schemes, urban drainage and sewerage, hydropower, and water supply schemes.

item.description: Pre-Augering The process of reducing the density of the ground by essentially pre-drilling the area of sheet pile installation with an auger attached.

item.description: Priced Contract Priced contracts are where a lump sum of work is allocated for a project, and money is released under different conditions.

item.title: Soil Young's Modulus
item.description: Soil Young’s Modulus Soil Young’s modulus (E), commonly reffred to as soil elastic modulus, is an elastic soil parameter and a measure of soil stiffness.

item.title: Target Cost
item.description: Target Cost The Target Cost contract type differs from the Priced Contracts in that the risk is shared between the contractor and the client, in that a pre-agreed “pain/gain” share is agreed whereby any savings are shared between the client and contractor, as well as any losses as a result from exceeding the agreed price.

item.title: üèó Civil Engineering MOC
item.description: Civil Engineering “Civil engineers design, create and connect up the world around us. They help make our villages, towns and cities work for the people that live there.

item.title: üíµ Commercial MOC
item.description: Commercial MOC Civil engineering and the decisions made within it are all dictated by the commercial arrangements between the involved parties.

item.title: üíª Design MOC
item.description: Design MOC I started completing civil engineering design work as part of a [[Temporary Works]] design team. I am slowly gathering new methods and ways of solving problems, which I will share here for future reference.

item.title: üîß Temporary Works MOC
item.description: Temporary Works MOC “Temporary works can be described as providing an “engineered solution” that is used to support or protect either an existing structure or the permanent works during construction, or to support an item of plant or equipment, or the vertical sides or side-slopes of an excavation during construction operations on site or to provide access.

item.title: üî® Site Work MOC
item.description: Site Work The majority of my time within the civil engineering industry has been spent on site. That is, completing setting out activities, managing work gangs, planning and programming tasks and monitoring works.
